thread.title: Austin-based Kerbey Lane diner chain makes tentative plans to come to Houston
thread.title_full: Austin-based Kerbey Lane diner chain makes tentative plans to come to Houston

author: Craig Hlavaty, Houston Chronicle
title: Austin-based Kerbey Lane diner chain makes tentative plans to come to Houston
text:
There are multiple Houston-area locations. Click here to find the one near you . Hours: 24 hours a day, 7 days a week Chacho's for anything Tex-Mex There are multiple Houston-area locations. Click here to find the one near you . Hours: 24 hours a day, 7 days a week Photo: D. Fahleson, Houston Chronicle Image 16 of 17 
Okay, okay; we know this place isn't original to Houston. But come on, nothing beats a well-timed Whataburger. 
Okay, okay; we know this place isn't original to Houston. But come on, nothing beats a well-timed Whataburger. Photo: San Antonio Express-News File Photo Image 17 of 17 Austin-based Kerbey Lane diner chain makes tentative plans to come to Houston 1 / 17 Back to Gallery 
In the near-future Houstonians will be able to experience the magic of Kerbey Lane's expansive menu without driving a few hundred miles west. 
Last week Kerbey Lane CEO Mason Ayer told attendees at an Austin Business Journal forum that the chain will soon enter the Houston market. 
CHEESY: Kerbey Lane queso, an Austin late-night favorite, hits Whole Foods shelves 
There is no definitive timeline for when the expansion could happen, or where a Bayou City edition of Kerbey Lane would be located. 
"The word that comes to mind is 'terrified,'" Ayer told the crowd. "But it's something we feel we have to do. We are getting a little saturated here. Doing that first one in a new market will be the toughest one." 
The diner-style food at Kerbey Lane routinely makes Austin best-of lists for the queso, pancakes, and sandwiches. 
Kerbey Lane's blog keeps track of all the most important stats from each year of business. According to a year in review post, they served up 265,000 bowls of queso in 2016. 
Look no further for the perfect fluffy pancake! Media: MediaOS Video 
Kerbey Lane's famous pancake mix is sold in Whole Foods and H-E-B locations. They sold 1.48 million pancakes in 2016 alone. They offer featured pancakes each month at each location to boot. March's lineup includes Rocky Road, S'mores, Triple Chocolate Cherry and Elvis-inspired (peanut butter, bacon, and banana) pancakes 
NO MORE: Austin-based My Fit Foods announces closure of all stores 
The first Kerbey Lane location opened up in the spring of 1980. Over the years it expanded to all points in Austin, so eaters were never too far away from a Kerbey Lane. There is even a location in Round Rock now. Only four of the seven locations are open 24 hours. 
Most former University of Texas students will tell you though that the best location is the one near the UT campus, off Guadalupe.
